description:
Redbridge Institute of Adult Education, is opening its doors, for visitors to access 120 years of lifelong learning  history.
Visitors will benefit from workshops in employability skills such as; interview skills, digital skills and CV writing, whilst accessing an exhibition, displaying the rich history of  adult education in Redbridge over the last 120 years.

events.name: Drop in: Exhibition
events.notes: Access the rich history of adult education, which spans over 120 years, with the first courses for adults being introduced in Redbridge.

factsheet.heading: History of Redbridge
paragraphs:
Exhibition & Employability Workshops
As well as accessing 120 years of lifelong learning history in our exhibition area, where adult education was first founded, visitors will benefit from modern-day workshops in employability skills such as; CV writing,  interview skills & presentation skills throughout the day.

Talks 
From local historian talking about the history and changing face of Redbridge, to showcasing the "Ilford Mammoth" found in Ilford Lane in 1864, visitors can get a real sense of the transformation of this wonderful borough

Creative Arts Workshops
Visitors can have the opportunity to put their creativity to the test by participating in one of our pottery or  creative art workshops, run by our partners Mary Ward

Tours of the building
These will take place every hour from 11 - 2 where you will not only learn about the history of the building, but see its transition into modern day by visiting our green skills hub and experience  our immersive classroom.

Ilford Mammoth Trail 
Our young visitors will be able to enjoy the "Ilford Mammoth Trail" celebrating the discovery of a 200,000-year-old fossil in 1864 in Ilford Lane.  
Don't forget to collect your "mammoth" gift
